page.title: 07HOUSING IN OUR AREA
page.content: IN THE YEAR OF 1985 THERE WERE SIXTY EIGHT HOUSES IN AND AROUND LILLIESLEAF.THE AVERAGE HOUSE HAD SIX ROOMS AND WAS OVER ONE HUNDRED YEARS OLD.MOST HOUSES WERE OWNED BY THEIR OCCUPIER AND HAVE A GARDEN BACK AND FRONT.MOST HAVE A GARAGE AND ALL HAVE ELECTRICITY .MOST WERE TRADITIONAL TYPES OF HOUSES MADE OF STONE. THE MOST COMMON SOURCE OF HEAT WAS ELECTRICITY BUT MANY HOUSES HAVE STILL GOT AN OPEN FIRE.SOME HOUSES HAVE OIL OR GAS CENTRAL HEATING.MOST PEOPLE HAVE STAYED IN THEIR HOUSES BETWEEN FIVE AND TEN YEARS,BUT MANY OLD PEOPLE HAVE LIVED IN THEIR HOUSES FOR MUCH LONGER. THE BIGGEST HOUSE IS CHESTERKNOWES IT HAS TWENTY SEVEN ROOMS. IT IS WHITE. IT IS POWERED BY ELECTRICITY GAS AND BOILER.IT IS WELL OVER ONE HUNDRED YEARS OLD AND IS MADE OF STONE.
